intro: Acourtia hebeclada, commonly known as the yellow sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its growth habit is often shrub-like, with multiple stems branching from the base. Acourtia hebeclada is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert or coastal habitats.
